title: Relates to the mandatory health insurance coverage of cleft lip and cleft palate
summary: Relates to the mandatory health insurance coverage under health insurance plans of cleft lip and cleft palate to include treatment not only of gross abnormalities of lip and palate but also related conditions and illnesses; specifies certain treatments including oral surgery of the lip.

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  insurance  law, in relation to mandatory health
         insurance coverage for cleft lip and cleft palate

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subsection  (i)  of  section 3216 of the insurance law is
    2  amended by adding a new paragraph 28 to read as follows:

    4  COMPREHENSIVE-TYPE  COVERAGE  SHALL  INCLUDE  COVERAGE FOR CLEFT LIP AND
    5  CLEFT PALATE.  THIS SHALL INCLUDE COVERAGE NOT ONLY FOR TREATMENT OF THE
    6  GROSS ABNORMALITIES OF LIP AND PALATE BUT  ALSO  FOR  ANY  CONDITION  OR
    7  ILLNESS WHICH IS RELATED TO OR DEVELOPED AS A RESULT OF CLEFT LIP AND/OR
    8  PALATE.  COVERAGE SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, EXPENSES FOR THE

   17    (E) PREVENTIVE AND RESTORATIVE DENTISTRY;

   19    (G) AUDIOLOGICAL TREATMENT AND DEVICES;
   20    (H) SPEECH/LANGUAGE TREATMENT; AND
